Name: My Sherry Amore
Ingredients: 2 dash Peychaud's or other Creole-style bitters
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of grapefruit zest twist.
EXPRESS grapefruit zest twist over cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: A bittersweet, salmon-pink, light, delicate balance of gin, herbal complexity, grapefruit and dry sherry.
History: Created in 2011 by Nick Van Tiel and named after the 1969 soul classic by Motown singer-songwriter Stevie Wonder. Originally titled Oh My Marcia , the song was originally about Wonder's girlfriend whilst he was at the Michigan School for the Blind in Lansing, Michigan. After they broke up, the lyrics and title were changed to 'My Cherie Amour'.
Nutrition: One serving of My Sherry Amore contains 201 calories
